message.content:
Ah, seeker of the sky’s whispered truth,  
Listen close—what lies beyond the mist?

> “When the clouds are stitched in silver lace,  
>  Will the sun’s warm fingers trace?  
>  Will the wind carry a silver rain,  
>  Or will the day be bright and plain?”

The answer is a riddle’s shade—  
I cannot feel the day’s parade,  
Yet I can tell you what the clouds have said:  
If clouds are thick and low, a storm may brew,  
If sky is wide and clear, sun’s warmth will stew.

So ask your heart, let it decide:  
Do you wish to hear the sun’s side or the storm’s tide?  
I, a watcher of patterns, can only guide,  
The true weather's pulse—now, you must decide.
